data.title: Robinson Funeral Home
data.meta_description: Recent and previous obituaries in Easley, SC at Robinson Funeral Home. Find your loved one in our local public obituary posts. Search now.
data.text:
Reverend J. Wallace Hughes

Jan 14, 1937 - Aug 26, 2024

Reverend J. Wallace HughesGreer, SC Rev. J. Wallace Hughes, husband of the late Donnie Vea Hamlin Hughes, and son of the late Norman L. and Beatrice M. Hughes, departed from this earthly life to heaven on Monday, August 26, 2024. Reverend Hughes was a graduate of Liberty High School (1955), Furman University (1959), and Southwestern Baptist Theological…

Marshall Odell Hall

Jul 21, 1945 - Aug 24, 2024

Mr. Marshall Odell Hall, 79, husband of Faye Chappell Hall, went to be with his Lord and Savior Saturday, August 24, 2024.Born in Greenville County, a son of the late Lewis Hall and the late Bernice Evans Hall, Mr. Hall retired from Ryobi and was a member of Tabernacle Baptist Church for more than fifty…

Ollie Mae Grant

Aug 18, 1943 - Aug 24, 2024

Ollie Mae Grant, 81, of Central, wife to David F. Grant, passed away Saturday, August 24, 2024.Born in Pickens County, she was the daughter of the late William H. Barrett and Blanch Smith Barrett. Mrs. Grant worked in textiles most of her working career. She enjoyed being with her family and working in her flower…

Trevor Zion Bauknight

Jun 30, 1969 - Aug 23, 2024

With humble acceptance of God’s will, we announce the passing of Trevor Zion Bauknight, 55, on August 22, 2024. He was the beloved husband of Amanda Cox both of Easley and formerly Sumter, South Carolina.Born in Kingsport, Tennessee and raised in Sumter, South Carolina, he was the son of Amanda Mosier Bauknight and Dennis Lehman…

David Alan Neely

May 4, 1961 - Aug 22, 2024

David Alan Neely, 63, passed away peacefully on Thursday, August 22, 2024, surrounded by his loving family. Born in Greenville, he was a son of Norman “Gene” and Mary Wilson Neely and was of Baptist faith. David enjoyed fixing all things and playing video games. He was an avid fisherman and loved to go camping. His…

Ann B. Furr

Sep 13, 1942 - Aug 22, 2024

Ann Blake Furr, 81, loving wife of Dr. Edward Kim Furr, went to be with her Lord and Savior Thursday, August 22, 2024 at her home.Born in Richland County, South Carolina, and reared in Belton, Mrs. Furr was a daughter of the late Lewis deVeaux Blake, Jr. and the late Alice Utincie Horton Blake. She…

Neal Lafayette Dickerson

Nov 4, 1928 - Aug 20, 2024

Neal Lafayette Dickerson, aged 95 years, went to be with his Lord and Savior on August 20, 2024. Neal was a resident of Easley, SC since 2014, living first at the Willows Senior Community and finally at Foothills Presbyterian Community.Neal was born in Rabun Gap, GA, on November 4, 1928, to R M (Melton) Dickerson…

Howard Dorman "Dyke" Spencer

Jan 4, 1957 - Aug 20, 2024

Howard “Dyke” Spencer, 67, of Clemson, South Carolina, passed away at home on August 20, 2024. Born in Sumter, SC, on January 4, 1957, Dyke lived a life marked by service, hard work, and a deep love for his family and community. Dyke attended Clemson University for two years before attaining his Bachelors of Science in…

Edith Lollis Reeves

Sep 2, 1931 - Aug 19, 2024

Edith L. ReevesEasley, SC Edith Lollis Reeves, 92, beloved wife of 76 years to the late Glenn Terror Reeves, passed away at her home on Monday, August 19, 2024. Born in Pickens County, she was a daughter of the late Willie Hyson Lollis and Ethel Blackwell Lollis. Mrs. Reeves retired from Mayfair Mills, Glenwood Plant, after 50 years…
